title: 105_s887
content: The Act titled "National Underground Railroad Network to Freedom Act of 1997" is established for the purpose of recognizing the significance of the Underground Railroad. Congress finds that the Underground Railroad was a significant expression of the American civil rights movement, bridging divides of race, religion, and nationality to uphold ideals of liberty and freedom. The Underground Railroad Advisory Committee conducted a study to establish a national commemorative program for education and reconciliation. The Underground Railroad Advisory Committee found that many important sites are in danger of being lost, while others have high potential for preservation in various states. No single site fully represents the Underground Railroad, as its story involves networks and regions across the country. Partnerships between the Federal Government, other levels of government, and the private sector are crucial for preservation efforts. The National Park Service can play a vital role in facilitating the national commemoration of the Underground Railroad. The story and significance of the Underground Railroad can best engage the American people through a national program that links historic buildings, structures, sites, routes, interpretive centers, museums, and programs in a unified and flexible manner. The purposes of this Act are to recognize the importance of the Underground Railroad, the sacrifices made by slaves seeking freedom, and the sacrifices made by those who helped them. The National Park Service is authorized to coordinate activities commemorating the Underground Railroad's history, significance in the civil rights movement, and relevance in promoting racial harmony and national reconciliation. The National Park Service is authorized to coordinate activities commemorating the Underground Railroad's history, significance in the civil rights movement, and relevance in promoting racial harmony and national reconciliation. Additionally, there is a National Underground Railroad Network to Freedom Program established. The Secretary of the Interior will establish the National Underground Railroad Network to Freedom program within the National Park Service. This program will produce educational materials, enter into agreements for technical assistance, and create an official symbol for the network. The National Network will include units or programs related to the Underground Railroad and properties with verifiable connections to it. The National Underground Railroad Network to Freedom program, established by the Secretary of the Interior, includes properties with verifiable connections to the Underground Railroad. The Secretary may enter into cooperative agreements with other entities to ensure effective coordination. Authorization of appropriations is provided for carrying out this Act. Authorization of appropriations for the National Underground Railroad Network to Freedom program includes $500,000 for fiscal year 1998 and $1,000,000 for each subsequent fiscal year.
